##  Cumulative Abnormal Return (CAR) Around News

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| results: asis
library(webexercises)

set.seed(NULL)
# Randomized in percent units (not bp)
ar0_pct     <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 0.80, sd = 0.40), 2)  # event-day AR in %
days        <- sample(3:6, 1)
ardrift_pct <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 0.10, sd = 0.08), 2)  # avg daily AR after event in %/day
CAR_pct     <- round(ar0_pct + days * ardrift_pct, 2)
```

A firm-specific news generates an **event-day abnormal return = `r ar0_pct`%**, followed by **`r days` days** with an **average abnormal return of `r ardrift_pct`% per day**.

✅ <strong>CAR logic (in %):</strong> Sum abnormal returns over the window.<br>
CAR = AR<sub>0</sub> + ∑<sub>t&gt;0</sub> AR<sub>t</sub> = 
`r ar0_pct`% + `r days` × `r ardrift_pct`% = <strong>`r CAR_pct`%</strong>.<br><br>
<em>Interpretation:</em> Under semi-strong EMH, prices should adjust quickly to news.  
A post-event drift (positive or negative) may indicate delayed reaction or under/overreaction.
